result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn M Peabody was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  
COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 1 day time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment. Court recommends electronic monitoring and release to the Day Reporting Center.   The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of
18 months with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*Obtain GED or HSED.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Parties stipulate and Court waived the DNA sample and mandatory surcharge as the offense date was prior to 4-1-15.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 1 day time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  Court recommends electronic monitoring and release to the Day Reporting Center. The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of
18 months with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Obtain GED or HSED.  
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Parties stipulate and Court waived the DNA sample and mandatory surcharge as the offense date was prior to 4-1-15.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Shawn M Peabody in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.
  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to COUNT 1:  Misdemeanor Fleeing, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 346.04(2t), 346.17(2t), an unclassified Misdemeanor and COUNT 2:  Obstruction/Resisting an Officer, 946.41(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Defendant Shawn M Peabody in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shawn M Peabody in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-08-2015 at 08:30 am.
